intro: Hermione flava, commonly known as the golden muse, is a rare flowering plant native to the temperate regions of southern Europe. It features striking yellow petals that bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It prefers well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a hardy addition to gardens. Its unique coloration and fragrance make it a sought-after specimen among botanists and horticulturists.
